org.javaToAvalla.model

Class Scenario

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.javaToAvalla.model.Scenario

  • public class Scenario
extends java.lang.Object
    The Scenario class represents a scenario that consists of a queue of AvallaTerm objects.

    This class manages the sequence of terms used in a scenario and tracks whether the scenario is valid based on the inclusion of at least one AvallaStepTerm.

    The validity of the scenario is updated when an AvallaStepTerm is added to the scenario, and it uses a LinkedList internally to maintain the order of the terms.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Queue<AvallaTerm> scenario
      A queue of AvallaTerm objects representing the scenario.
      private boolean valid
      Flag indicating whether the scenario contains at least one AvallaStepTerm, making it valid.

      • getScenario

        public java.util.Queue<AvallaTerm> getScenario()

        Returns:
        the scenario queue.

      • add

        public void add(AvallaTerm avallaTerm)
        Adds an AvallaTerm to the scenario.

        If the term is an instance of AvallaStepTerm, the scenario is marked as valid.

        Parameters:
        avallaTerm - the term to be added to the scenario.

      • remove

        public AvallaTerm remove()
        Removes and returns the first term in the scenario queue.
        Returns:
        the removed term.

      • element

        public AvallaTerm element()
        Retrieves, but does not remove, the first term in the scenario queue.
        Returns:
        the first term in the scenario.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Returns whether the scenario is valid, i.e., contains at least one AvallaStepTerm.
        Returns:
        true if the scenario is valid, false otherwise.
